meanings.definition: A playful rubbing of the knuckles on a person's head.
meanings.sent1: After winning the game, Tim gave his friend a noogie to celebrate.
meanings.sent2: My brother always gives me a noogie when he's in a good mood.
meanings.sent3: The noogie from Sarah left a mess of hair standing up on my head.
meanings.sent4: The noogie felt like a tiny massage on my scalp.
meanings.sent5: I'll never forget the noogie I got after acing the test.

meanings.sent1: I playfully noogied my friend's head as a joke.
meanings.sent2: He noogies his little brother whenever he annoys him.
meanings.sent3: She threatened to noogie him if he didn't stop teasing her.
meanings.sent4: The mischievous boy noogied his friend during recess.
meanings.sent5: Remember to noogie gently, so it's fun for both of you.

meanings.definition: The act of giving someone a noogie.
meanings.sent1: The noogie was meant to be a friendly gesture among friends.
meanings.sent2: She received a noogie as part of a silly tradition in their group.
meanings.sent3: The noogie contest at the party had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: He performed a noogie on his buddy with a big grin.
meanings.sent5: The noogie exchange between the siblings was a daily occurrence.
